q: concerts). With researcher and writer Adam Machado, Chris Strachwitz combed the dusty corners of his tape library for sessions he never forgot. "I knew they were there," he says. As a result, Egypt's economy, which depends heavily on tourism, is taking a toll. It is estimated that one million tourists have fled Cairo since the protests began on Jan. 25. All the people who live around here, they depend on the lives of tourists, Zahi Hawass said. "If there is no tourism, there is no food for the people."
